Transparency.justification: Score = 0.5 because 2 source(s) (listed below) contain only high-level principle statements.

relevantSources.title: Global Responsible Artificial Intelligence Policy - MetLife
relevantSources.summary: MetLife's AI policy outlining transparency and explainability principles for AI decisions.

relevantSources.title: Responsible Governance - MetLife Sustainability Report
relevantSources.summary: Sustainability report detailing responsible AI approach including transparency requirements.

Transparency.findings: MetLife outlines transparency as a guiding principle in its Responsible AI Policy and ESG reporting, referencing explainability and transparency requirements. However, the sources provide broad commitments rather than detailed, verifiable transparency artifacts or model cards.

Fairness & Bias Mitigation.justification: Score = 1 because 2 source(s) (listed below) contain detailed, verifiable information.

relevantSources.title: Global Responsible Artificial Intelligence Policy - MetLife
relevantSources.summary: Policy explicitly states AI solutions will not produce discriminatory outcomes.

relevantSources.title: Responsible Governance - MetLife Sustainability Report
relevantSources.summary: Discusses fairness, transparency and explainability underpinned by bias management processes.

Fairness & Bias Mitigation.findings: MetLife provides concrete evidence of fairness and bias mitigation, explicitly prohibiting discriminatory outcomes in its AI policy and describing bias management processes in its sustainability reporting. These sources demonstrate a substantive commitment to fairness in AI.

Explainability.justification: Score = 0.5 because 1 source(s) (listed below) contain only high-level principle statements.

relevantSources.title: Global Responsible Artificial Intelligence Policy - MetLife
relevantSources.summary: States AI decisions must be explainable as core transparency principle.

Explainability.findings: MetLife's Responsible AI Policy states that AI decisions must be explainable, but does not provide details on specific methods, tools, or processes for achieving explainability. The evidence is limited to a high-level policy statement.

Human Oversight & Accountability.justification: Score = 0.5 because 2 source(s) (listed below) contain only high-level principle statements.

relevantSources.title: Global Responsible Artificial Intelligence Policy - MetLife
relevantSources.summary: Policy states AI solutions designed with appropriate human oversight mechanisms.

relevantSources.title: Talent and Skill Development - MetLife Sustainability Report
relevantSources.summary: Discusses AI combined with human oversight and direction for responsible strategy.

Human Oversight & Accountability.findings: MetLife's policy and ESG report reference the importance of human oversight in AI systems, stating that AI is designed with oversight mechanisms. However, there are no details on oversight workflows, committees, or appeal processes.

Privacy & Security.justification: Score = 0.5 because 2 source(s) (listed below) contain only high-level principle statements.

relevantSources.title: Global Responsible Artificial Intelligence Policy - MetLife
relevantSources.summary: AI policy includes privacy requirements and resiliency security principles.

relevantSources.title: MetLife + Aura Identity and Fraud Protection
relevantSources.summary: AI-powered identity protection services with privacy-preserving technology and security measures.

Privacy & Security.findings: MetLife's policy and product pages mention privacy and security as core requirements for AI, referencing privacy-preserving technology and security principles. There is no detailed explanation of data handling, anonymization, or encryption standards.

Governance & Accountability.justification: Score = 1 because 2 source(s) (listed below) contain detailed, verifiable information.

relevantSources.title: Global Responsible Artificial Intelligence Policy - MetLife
relevantSources.summary: Establishes data governance and strategic oversight for AI design and deployment.

relevantSources.title: Responsible Governance - MetLife Sustainability Report
relevantSources.summary: Details governance mechanisms and responsible AI governance structure within organization.

Governance & Accountability.findings: MetLife provides concrete evidence of AI governance, describing formal frameworks for data governance and oversight in both its Responsible AI Policy and ESG reporting. These sources detail organizational structures and governance mechanisms for AI.

summary.overallFindings: MetLife demonstrates strong commitments to fairness, bias mitigation, and governance in its Responsible AI Policy and ESG reporting, providing detailed descriptions of bias management and governance frameworks. Other pillars, including transparency, explainability, human oversight, and privacy, are supported by high-level policy statements but lack detailed, verifiable evidence or implementation specifics. There is no public evidence of external audits or public commitments to third-party AI frameworks. Overall, MetLife's Responsible AI disclosures are robust in principle but would benefit from greater transparency and external validation.
